metadata.notes: Easter sermon focusing on the objective reality of the Resurrection versus subjective interpretation.

freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.score_explanation: 10 = Completely free from coercive judgments. 0 = Very dominant Critical Parent.
freedom_from_critical_parent_CP.analysis: The preacher uses a 'shaming' technique against 'sophisticated' or 'urbane' believers, labeling alternative views as 'timid' or 'wishy-washy.' This creates a dogmatic 'must' regarding literalism.
quotes: Do you believe what you have said?
I have been present with people at the time of death many times and I have never become immune... I confess that it is not enough for me.

healthy_care_NP.score_explanation: 10 = Healthy, non-smothering care. 0 = Absent or smothering.
healthy_care_NP.analysis: Nurturing Parent appears in the shared empathy for the 'inconsolably bereaved,' though it is quickly pivoted toward a dogmatic solution rather than sitting with the grief.
quotes: Many people are comforted by thoughts such as this... Maybe it is enough for you.

adult.analysis: The preacher acknowledges historical context and textual syntax (Adult data processing), but uses this data to shut down Adult reflection in the listener, pushing them toward a Child-like awe.
quotes: The syntax clearly indicates that their recognition of the risen Christ was initiated by God.
I know all the objections... I know it isn't possible as we understand possibility.

freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.score_explanation: 10 = Free from fear/compliance. 0 = Strong Adapted Child (fear culture).
freedom_from_adapted_child_AC.analysis: The preacher explicitly mentions that Christians feel 'sheepish' and 'ashamed,' then uses the sermon to correct this, effectively demanding a shift from a 'Skeptical Child' to a 'Believing Child.'
quotes: The cumulative result is to make Christians feel sheepish about their faith.

free_child_FC.analysis: There is a strong appeal to the Free Child's sense of wonder, 'goosebumps,' and 'thrill' of a victory parade.
quotes: I can feel the goosebumps on the back of my neck as I say this.
This is a time for fanfares and drum rolls.

transaction_analysis.analysis: The preacher takes a position of 'one who knows' and 'one who has seen death' (Parent) to address a congregation that is 'ashamed' or 'skeptical' (Child).
transaction_analysis.ulterior_motives: Socially A->A (discussing theology), Psychologically P->C ('I will tell you why your modern doubts are weak').
transaction_analysis.risk_explanation: The 'double bottom' lies in the false choice: either you believe in the literal, violent earthquake resurrection, or you are a 'scruffy nonentity' with 'wishy-washy' sentiments.

detected_games.name: NIGYSOB (Now I've Got You, You Son of a Bitch)

formula_g_analysis.con: Asks 'Do you believe what you said?' (The bait of sincerity).
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The listener's secret doubt or desire to be 'urbane'.
formula_g_analysis.switch: Quotes 'timid' sermons to show how wrong the 'sophisticated' view is.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The listener feels guilty/small; the preacher feels superior in their 'unashamed' faith.

evidence_quotes: I asked him afterward why he had been so timid...
If that doesn't make your hair stand on end, I have not read it right.

detected_games.name: Bait & Switch

formula_g_analysis.con: Starts with a shared, ancient greeting (Christ is Risen).
formula_g_analysis.gimmick: The listener's desire for tradition and belonging.
formula_g_analysis.switch: Moves from 'isn't this a wonderful custom' to 'your modern version of this is actually a diabolical joke'.
formula_g_analysis.payoff: The listener abandons their own interpretation for the preacher's 'dynamite' version.

evidence_quotes: Well, we have said it. Now let me ask you a question. Do you believe what you have said?

preacher_roles.rescuer: High: Rescuing the congregation from their 'sheepishness' and 'timidity'.
preacher_roles.persecutor: Medium: Attacking the 'Ph.D. student' and 'mainline preachers' as bad examples.
preacher_roles.victim: Low: Briefly identifies with Paul being 'not ashamed' (implying a world that tries to shame him).

drama_triangle_analysis.congregation_position: Victim (of modern skepticism) or Persecutor (if they remain skeptical).
drama_triangle_analysis.escape_possibilities: Low. The sermon demands submission to the 'unimaginable' rather than Adult integration.

conclusion_and_recommendation.summary: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but psychologically coercive. It operates primarily from a Critical Parent position that shames intellectual nuance ('urbane,' 'timid') to force the listener into a Child-like state of 'stupefied awe.' While it aims to provide hope, it does so by invalidating the listener's Adult processing of grief and doubt, creating a dependency on the preacher's 'unashamed' conviction.
strengths: High Free Child energy (joy, wonder, imagery).
Strong use of Adult data regarding biblical syntax.
areas_for_improvement: Binary framing (Literalism vs. 'Wishy-washy' symbols) ignores the Adult's capacity for metaphor.
conclusion_and_recommendation.advice_for_game_free_communication: Try moving from 'I confess it is not enough for me' (which sets a Parent standard) to 'How do we process the gap between our doubt and this text?' Invite the listener's Adult to the table rather than demanding their Child's goosebumps.
